diff_hunk:
@@ -46,5 +46,8 @@ def gather_map(outputs):
             return Gather.apply(target_device, dim, *outputs)
         if out is None:
             return None
-        return type(out)(map(gather_map, zip(*outputs)))
+        if isinstance(out, dict):
+            return dict(zip(out.keys(),
+                            map(gather_map, zip(*[d.values() for d in outputs]))))
body: @apaszke Not necessarily. It is not guaranteed that every dict's `.items()` is of the same order. So it's still better to index into every dict using a reference dict's keys.
body_html: @apaszke Not necessarily. It is not guaranteed that every dict's .items() is of the same order. So it's still better to index into every dict using a reference dict's keys.
body_text: @apaszke Not necessarily. It is not guaranteed that every dict's .items() is of the same order. So it's still better to index into every dict using a reference dict's keys.
